data.job_description:
Development Informatics

Human-Centered Digital Transformation

SCOPE OF WORK

CONSULTANT NAME:

POSITION TITLE:

TOTAL LEVEL OF EFFORT:

TBD

Human Centered Digital Transformation Researcher

70 days

AGREEMENT NAME:

AGREEMENT NUMBER:

BUY-IN ACTIVITY:

Digital Frontiers

AID-OAA-A-17-00033

Informatics

PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE:

EVALUATOR:

July-October 2023

Priya Sethi

BACKGROUND

USAID’s Digital Societies and Governments (formerly Development Informatics team) Team’s vision is to empower people, communities, and governments to achieve better development outcomes through a more equitable, digitally-enabled world. We work to advance inclusive and resilient societies by collaborating with stakeholders to build knowledge and address emerging risks and opportunities in data governance and digital government.

USAID and the broader development community seek clearer ways to understand and address how digital transformation impacts humanity, especially when those impacts cross traditional development sectors and different populations. The development community needs a better way to understand the impact of technology designs, and in the decision making, governance, and the use of data for all humans.

One potential approach is what the Agency is tentatively calling Human Centered Digital Transformation. This approach builds on social justice, digital transformation, and human rights conversations that are taking place within and outside of the digital development sphere. The Agency would like to learn more about these dialogues and from communities that have different perspectives on this topic (eg. social justice, feminism & technology, social philosophy, data governance). The Agency also recognizes that different sectors may have used this approach in ways that we can learn from, especially in democracy, human rights, philosophy, governance, education technology, digital health, and digital agriculture. How are people defining human-centered digital transformation, and adjacent terms? What are different approaches? What should the Agency apply in our programming? How may these perspectives help the development community refocus digitalization efforts towards human and societal well being?

This research is intended to reflect a shift: that the landscape for digital development has changed. In the past, development practitioners asked “how can digital interventions help achieve better development outcomes”? It was assumed that digital interventions were, at worst, benign, and at best, supportive of values such as inclusion and well-being for all. Yet, digital transformation opened opportunities for harm alongside benefits. These harms include phishing, abusive behaviors, and mis/dis-information. Digital transformation has amplified existing power dynamics, elite capture, and alienation, while divides in power mean that some, often those already vulnerable, cannot meaningfully shape how this transformation impacts them. Emerging technologies such as generative AI create further unknowns.

After experiencing the past three decades of digital transformation in the world, the development community is asking: “How is digital transformation impacting humanity? Are there human-centered digital transformation approaches that can shape a better world for all? The shift sounds subtle, but it reflects a growing awareness that the benefits and risks of digital transformation have not been evenly distributed. This shift has incredible implications for USAID’s work. The development community needs better ways to – at a minimum - Do No Harm - and ideally, make investments that - Do Better - to improve development outcomes across a broad swath of people.

OBJECTIVE

Digital Frontiers seeks a consultant to define human-centered digital transformation (or alternative term), what it means for the Agency’s mission, and how it can be applied to further the Agency’s work in digital development. The Agency is seeking a research paper and a vision to consider in future Technology Division work, primarily focused on the Digital Societies and Governments Team’s portfolio in digital government and data governance. This activity will help USAID position itself in the broader discussions, work, and efforts in the development and digital landscape and improve the Agency’s understanding how it can best move forward. The outputs will provide USAID with the outcome of foundational knowledge, including:
• Key definitions of human-centered digital transformation and related terms, for a USAID and public audience.
• Landscaping of other actors engaged in this space, key initiatives, associated risks and challenges of approaches, and existing resources, for a USAID and public audience.
• Summary of what can be gained from this approach by the communities we work with and a vision/call to action for the international development community (to be defined iteratively with the consultant - but grounded in the articulated needs/desires/cautions of the countries and populations we work with) for how investing in human-centered digital transformation can support USAID’s and other major actors’ work (eg. in different sectors, regions, and USAID initiatives); and
• Recommendations for how donors/key development actors, including USAID, can integrate human centered digital transformation into their work, including potential engagement with broader stakeholders (eg. how the development community can/should engage other stakeholders such as technology companies, civil society, governing bodies, and technology investors).

TASKS

1. Develop Inception Report

This inception report should be completed a few weeks after the project start, after preliminary conversations with the team and high-level document review, to reflect the final approach agreed to with USAID at the start of the work. The report should include:
• Outline of research protocol
• Summary understanding of purpose, rationale, and goals of the research.
• Research approach
• Key research questions to be answered
• Identified and proposed data sources (such as document review, survey, interviews, sampling, etc.) for the key research questions
• Proposed data collection instruments
• Proposed analysis approach

2. Develop comprehensive research report with reference materials

The Research Report will include findings on existing definitions and discussion on how “human-centered digital transformation” or related terms are being used, by whom, and considerations for a definition. The deliverable will include the following, plus a high-level summary slide deck for external audiences:
• Landscape analysis and discussion, to include 3-5 illustrative examples of human-centered digital transformation in action, 3-5 illustrative examples of digital transformation that is not .human-centered
• Summary of 20-25 key informant interviews and focus group discussions
• Literature inventory to identify common terms and frameworks within and beyond USAID/USG, the development community, academia, and civil society.
• Organizations and Contacts inventory to identify key points of contact and organizations relevant to USAID, disaggregated by role, sector, and influence
• Definitions inventory to demonstrate how this term is being defined, by whom, adjacent terms and definitions
• Examples inventory to include examples of human-centered digital transformation with citations
• Key Informant Interview questions and findings for review and input by USAID and consultant

3. Draft Vision Paper

The draft Vision paper will include the definition and vision for the international development community with high level summary of research findings and recommendations. The deliverable will be a paper and slide deck for review and approval by USAID.

4. Host Vision Workshop

The consultant is asked to co-host up to five 55-minute workshops with USAID staff to validate the definition, vision, and recommendations for USAID. USAID will schedule these workshops, organize invitations and registration, and co-host with the consultant, using USAID systems. The consultant will facilitate workshops with USAID key stakeholders, lead presentations on the research and vision, facilitate discussion amongst attendees, and capture feedback for incorporation into the Final Vision Paper.

5. Draft Final Vision Paper and Slides

The vision paper will be validated during workshops, and revisions identified in those workshops will be incorporated by the consultant into the final version. The consultant will not be responsible for final copy editing and graphic design of the document, although the consultant should deliver drafts that are accessible and readable.

DELIVERABLES

Deliverable 1: Inception report (google doc/sheets)

Deliverable 2: Research Report, including Inventories

Deliverable 3: Draft Vision paper

Deliverable 4: Vision Workshop

Deliverable 5: Final Vision paper and slides

Deliverables should be submitted with Google products

Deliverables may result in internal and external versions of the reports and related materials. Plain language (see plainlanguage.gov) should be closely considered (e.g. imperialism casting, translation impacts, reading level, accessibility) in drafts of deliverables. The use of visuals/diagrams, stories, and examples to illustrate key concepts are encouraged.

Digital Frontiers will provide final graphic design, copy editing, and 508 compliance.

TIMEFRAME AND LOE

The estimated timeframe is from July-October 2023. The estimated level of effort is 70 days.

Location: May be based anywhere but must be available to overlap with EST time zone for weekly meetings.

Preferred Qualifications
• The consultant should come from a USAID partner country and/or have grounded and relevant experience working in USAID partner countries.
• The consultant should use cross-sectoral approaches, including awareness of potential different definitions or priorities by sector, but ideally seek holistic approaches that are sector agnostic.
• The consultant should prioritize key informant interviews and resources sourced from LMICs when performing this work.
• Excellent English written and oral communication skills
• Excellent research skills with proven ability to summarize large volumes of information in a concise, digestible report that is accessible for international development practitioners and policy staff that are unfamiliar with digital development

Qualifications: Plain language (see plainlanguage.gov) should be closely considered (e.g. imperialism casting, translation impacts, reading level, accessibility) in drafts of deliverables
The use of visuals/diagrams, stories, and examples to illustrate key concepts are encouraged
Responsibilities: This activity will help USAID position itself in the broader discussions, work, and efforts in the development and digital landscape and improve the Agency’s understanding how it can best move forward
The outputs will provide USAID with the outcome of foundational knowledge, including:
Key definitions of human-centered digital transformation and related terms, for a USAID and public audience
Landscaping of other actors engaged in this space, key initiatives, associated risks and challenges of approaches, and existing resources, for a USAID and public audience

Summary of what can be gained from this approach by the communities we work with and a vision/call to action for the international development community (to be defined iteratively with the consultant - but grounded in the articulated needs/desires/cautions of the countries and populations we work with) for how investing in human-centered digital transformation can support USAID’s and other major actors’ work (eg

Recommendations for how donors/key development actors, including USAID, can integrate human centered digital transformation into their work, including potential engagement with broader stakeholders (eg
how the development community can/should engage other stakeholders such as technology companies, civil society, governing bodies, and technology investors)
Develop Inception Report

Researcher, Relatable with Allie Beth Stuckey

About You:

You work hard and have fun doing it. You have excellent language and communication skills and know how to unpack a good story for Allie’s audience when you see it. You understand the modern political and cultural environment and can translate that into entertaining and informative content. You value accuracy and attention to detail. You are a self-starter that likes to collaborate. You maintain high quality in your work while meeting tight deadlines. You are driven to create research packages for episodes and guest segments that allow for conversations not happening anywhere else in conservative media.

Job Responsibilities:
• Create a daily show rundown of summarized and fully researched topics and stories decided upon by the team (usually around 1pm CT), to be completed by 6pm CT each day before the next day’s show (we film Monday - Thursday mornings, so research on Sundays will be needed).
• Create show rundowns featuring short book summaries and relevant topical articles for guest segments.
• Be flexible after 6pm CT for minor adjustments to show rundown.
• Keep up to date on news of the day, regularly pitching stories and topics (both in the theology and political sphere), and segments that will interest Relatable listeners.
• Spend time watching the show to better understand how to shape rundowns and research.
• Be familiar with various news outlets and their biases and ensure everything is fact-checked sufficiently.
• Occasionally prep research for special episodes and live shows (such as Election Night specials).

Qualifications :
• 1 year of related experience preferred, but not required
• Proven track record of strong news and editorial judgement

Education:

Your education credentials don’t matter as much as on-the-job experience and quality of work.

Benefits:
• Remote work allowed for this position
• We cherish our people, and we’re building one of the best places to work in America. We have a driven, team-focused work culture that works hard and plays hard.
• Work with and learn from industry experts who have pioneered the independent conservative media landscape.
• No COVID vaccine mandate (we like freedom).
• Actually make a difference by fighting back against the woke insanity plaguing America. Our shows and content shape the narrative. We’re steering the national conversation on some of the most pressing issues facing our country, and this is your chance to be a part of it.

Overview

POSITION SUMMARY

As a professional level member of the Product Experience team with global corporate level responsibilities, the User Experience Researcher I will be accountable for clearly indicating what constitutes a positive user experience of new and existing products. Achieving this responsibility using research and data analysis tools to:
• Lead User Experience Reviews for new product development
• Provide assessments and fact-based guidance during new product development
• Understand positive and negative drivers of ratings/reviews of current and competitive products
• Design and execute custom research and provide clear and actionable insights

Responsibilities

POSITION PROFILE
• Key contributor in Global Product Development Process by providing key deliverables to the Technical Team Leader (TTL), Marketing and Program Management.
• Drivers of competitive product ratings/reviews
• Opportunities to improve current product already on the market
• Consumer Journey Mapping to understand strengths and weaknesses from user experience perspective
• Utilize design guidelines and standards to increase development speed and ensure optimal user experience
• User Experience (UX) reviews of sub systems, prototypes and engineering build units
• Usability study reports, including suggestions for how to improve product experience
• Post launch analysis to identify short and long term opportunities for improvement
• Provides data and insights to inform key decisions about product innovation and portfolio prioritization
• Provides regular interdepartmental oral presentations
• Participates in product design reviews and provides perspective on user experience
• Ensures appropriate testing has been completed to assess the design
• Ensures the project is ready to move into the next development phase.

• Ensuring input data is accurate

• Initiating actions for product improvements

• Delivers Results

• Learning Versatility

• Usability or User Experience (UX) Certification preferred
• Proactive rather than reactive problem solution philosophy
• Good, self-motivated project management and time management skills

• Physical Requirements:

• The ability to use powered and hand tools to disassemble/reassemble a product
• The ability to distinguish subtle color variations (good color acuity)

data.job_description:
We are the Corporate User Experience Research team. We are looking for a highly creative and passionate user experience researcher to join our team focused on internal-facing enterprise systems and applications to create a better experience for our global network of 270,000+ employees.

The User Experience Researcher brings a highly skilled, human-centric component to the UX team, working on a range of activities such as discovering user needs, developing innovative service ideas, collaborating across teams and stakeholder groups, and testing design concepts before bringing them to market.

Your days will be spent researching projects, learning about user behavior, and working side by side with designers, technologists, and product managers, to create a shared vision for the future of the HR space.

Your main focus will be providing product and UX teams with the tools and self-awareness they need to continuously grow in knowledge about our clients and employees, generating actionable data. The Continuous Insights service you define for JP Morgan, and the engagement model with regions and teams in the business will help facilitate a culture in which empathy and outcomes become a core capability for growth. You will partner with teams who seek to understand through empirical observation, experience and making.

Job Responsibilities
• Conduct research, synthesize findings, and communicate insights to inspire teams, catalyze design, and fuel strategic decisions
• Work collaboratively with other researchers, designers, partners, and teams through all phases of a project
• Test prototypes and reference designs for websites, apps, and other digital experiences, all with the ecosystem and journey of end users in mind
• Demonstrate a higher than usual degree of user empathy, and will be able to tell a compelling story about the motivations and intentions of our users, inspiring all stakeholders towards “Aha!” moments.
• Be able to take sometimes, fuzzy-headed notions and craft those into solid, testable research hypotheses around which you will design and deliver the appropriate research.
• Have excellent project management and organizational skills and be able to work collaboratively and productively with diverse teams and as well as independently.
• Develop research strategies and proposals and execute on time and on budget.

Required Qualifications, Capabilities, and Skills
• Extensive knowledge of user experience research tools and techniques (e.g., generative research planning and executing, interviews, usability testing, benchmarking, card sorts, etc.), and know the strengths and weaknesses of each.
• Bachelor’s degree in Human Computer Interaction, Cognitive Sciences, Anthropology, Technology Communications or related discipline from a major accredited college or university.
• 3-5 years or equivalent compelling experiences conducting or studying research, with at least ~6 months of post-academia experience conducting UX research or conducting research in the digital space.
• A balance of empathy, productivity + a passion for elegant, simple, emotionally rich design.
• Excellent communication, listening, and negotiation skills with clients and senior executives- write, speak and present information effectively, persuasively and confidently in a variety of communication/corporate settings.
• Experience across multiple teams and release cycles working closely with design, product management, and development to realize experiences designs using agile.

Preferred Qualifications, Capabilities, and Skills
• Master’s, Ph.D or other terminal degree in Human Computer Interaction, Cognitive Sciences, Anthropology, Technology Communications or related discipline from a major accredited college or university.
• Understanding of quantitative methodologies including survey design and analysis (in Excel, R or equivalent).
• Interest or previous experience working in Financial Services or Fintech.

data.job_description:
About the Team

STR’s Analytics division researches and develops advanced analytics and machine learning-based solutions to solve challenging problems related to national security. Our team consists of passionate and motivated engineers with advanced degrees in engineering, computer science, mathematics, and data science, who are seeking opportunities to use their deep technical knowledge and creativity to tackle some of the hardest problems that our customers face. Our projects span multiple different data modalities and incorporate advanced algorithms, deep learning, and statistical techniques to uncover patterns in social media, structured and unstructured text, time series, geospatial, and imagery data, and must operate under challenging constraints not typically found in the commercial world. The tools and technologies we develop have real world impact and US Government analysts use them to extract and enrich intelligence information around the globe.

The Role:

As a Machine Learning Researcher, you will utilize State of the Art (SOTA) deep learning methods to work with disparate and unlabeled multimodal data sources to create a knowledge engine that can be easily queried by humans. You will collaborate with a diverse team of people that includes, software engineers, algorithm developers, and academics. Your work will leverage cutting-edge learning techniques and demonstrably improve human-machine collaborative analysis for a real-life scenario.

What you will do:
• Work with unlabeled multimodal datasets to extract concept representations and their relationships.
• Implement methods for learning object, property, affordance, and activity representations in a shared latent space for modality-spanning concepts.
• Utilize the joint latent space representations to resolve inconsistencies within datasets and across modalities.
• Correlate similar/dissimilar concepts across modalities.
• Implement a continual learning approach that utilizes armed bandit techniques from RL to cast model retraining under data drift as a balance between exploration and exploitation.
• Collaborate with a diverse team that includes academics and industry partners.

Who you are:
• Hold a M.S. or Ph.D. in Machine Learning or Computer Science with concentration in Machine Learning (deep learning/reinforcement learning).
• U.S. citizen
• Experienced in using SOTA machine learning to solve real world problems, especially in settings where rich multimodal data is involved.
• Experienced with deep learning and optimization techniques in joint latent spaces.
• Experienced with scientific computing packages in python such as NumPy, SciPy, scikit-learn and tensor library PyTorch.
• Familiar with unsupervised and semi-supervised learning techniques.
• Familiar with version control (Git) and collaboration tools (JIRA, Confluence, or related).
• Capable of obtaining and maintaining a security clearance.

Nice to have:
• Deep learning experience that spans the domains of Computer Vision, Natural Language Processing (NLP), and to a more limited extent Reinforcement Learning (RL).
• Experienced with Graph Neural Networks and graph-based analyses (e.g., relation extraction, knowledge graph creation, hierarchical ontology construction, etc).

STR is a growing technology company with locations near Boston, MA, Arlington, VA, near Dayton, OH, Palm Bay, FL, and Carlsbad, CA. We specialize in advanced research and development for defense, intelligence, and national security, trying to understand how to protect our society: from stopping malicious botnet attacks, to understanding cyber vulnerabilities, providing next generation sensors, radar, sonar, communications, and electronic warfare to developing artificial intelligence algorithms and analytics to make sense of the complexity that is exploding around us.

STR is committed to creating a collaborative learning environment that supports deep technical understanding and recognizes the contributions and achievements of all team members. Our work is challenging, but you go home at night knowing that you pushed the forefront of technology and made the world a little safer. We recognize that the world is changing, that it is becoming more connected than ever before, making things change faster than before, and reshaping society in the process. We all want to understand this changing world and leave it better for our work.

STR is not just any company. Our people, culture, and attitude along with their unique set of skills, experiences, and perspectives put us on a trajectory to change the world. We can't do it alone, though - we need fellow trailblazers. If you are one, join our team and help to keep our society safe! Visit us at www.str.us for more info.

STR is an equal opportunity employer. We are fully dedicated to hiring the most qualified candidate regardless of race, color, religion, sex (including gender identity, sexual orientation and pregnancy), marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

If you need a reasonable accommodation for any portion of the employment process, email us at appassist@str.us and provide your contact info.

Pursuant to applicable federal law and regulations, positions at STR require employees to obtain national security clearances and satisfy the requirements for compliance with export control and other applicable laws.

Position Overview

The KU School of Social Welfare (KUSSW) seeks a full-time Assistant Researcher Senior to assist with program research, evaluation and data management for small and large-scale initiatives. The position will specialize in research and evaluation, data science projects, and social innovation work that supports initiatives' missions to optimize the well-being of children, youth, and families. KUSSW works with diverse community partners, including federal, state and community-based organizations, in their work to secure funding, bring key partners to the table, orchestrate large-scale data efforts, and conduct research, cost analysis, research and evaluation. We are looking for individuals who are passionate about impacting social change for good. The person in this position will promote healthy and thriving communities by contributing to research and evaluations of new or existing programs. The successful applicant should have experience in social sciences or a related field, prior experience working with community stakeholders, collecting, managing, analyzing, and reporting quantitative and qualitative data, and sharing findings with partners outside of the academic community. The applicant should also be able to facilitate continuous quality improvement (CQI), actively troubleshoot problems that may arise, and quickly develop and implement solutions. Experience working on issues related to child and family wellbeing. This position is contingent upon funding.Job Description

40%\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp; \u0026nbsp;Research and Evaluation Project Coordination\u0026nbsp;

•\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp; \u0026nbsp;Ensure that the projects meet the goals and objectives of the funder in cooperation with federal, state, and local partners
•\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp; \u0026nbsp;Track and coordinate deliverables, work plan, and timelines for timely and high-quality completion and of work
•\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp; \u0026nbsp;Plan, prepare, and facilitate meetings involving internal staff and external partners
•\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp; \u0026nbsp;Serve as point of contact between KUSSW and federal/state/local partners related to research and evaluation projects\u0026nbsp;
•\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp; \u0026nbsp;Support partner programs in accessing, understanding, and using their data and research and evaluation findings\u0026nbsp;
•\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp; \u0026nbsp;Supervise student hourlies, graduate students, or research assistants in carrying out research activities

30%\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp; \u0026nbsp;Data Management, Analysis, and Reporting

•\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp; \u0026nbsp;Assist with managing and securing program data
•\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp; \u0026nbsp;Collaborate with programs under guidance from project leaders to identify and implement data collection protocols and tools
•\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp; \u0026nbsp;Identify, prepare, and support data files, syntax, and analysis for evaluation and research projects, including advanced statistical analyses as appropriate
•\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp; \u0026nbsp;Assist with data formatting, processing, and analysis using Excel, SPSS, R, and other applications
•\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp; \u0026nbsp;Contribute to design, implementation, and maintenance of data-informed reports and analytics solutions including data visualizations and dashboards for different audiences (e.g., community stakeholders, policy makers, scholars)

20%\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp; \u0026nbsp;Research Methodology and Synthesis

•\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp; \u0026nbsp;Participate in the development and design of evaluation and research plans
•\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp; \u0026nbsp;Conduct multi-faceted evaluation and research projects as part of a team
•\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp; \u0026nbsp;Provide synthesis of research literature and/or evaluation and research project findings.\u0026nbsp;
•\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp; \u0026nbsp;Assist with preparing charts, tables, graphs, and written summaries of research and evaluation data and findings using excel and other data visualization applications
•\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp; \u0026nbsp;Assist senior researchers with preparation of written research and evaluation reports and manuscripts for publication, serving as a co-author as appropriate

Excellent organizational skills and experience working independently and as part of a team, as demonstrated in application materials and work experience.\u0026nbsp;Additional Candidate Instruction

The position will specialize in research and evaluation, data science projects, and social innovation work that supports initiatives' missions to optimize the well-being of children, youth, and families
The person in this position will promote healthy and thriving communities by contributing to research and evaluations of new or existing programs
The applicant should also be able to facilitate continuous quality improvement (CQI), actively troubleshoot problems that may arise, and quickly develop and implement solutions
40%\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp; \u0026nbsp;Research and Evaluation Project Coordination\u0026nbsp;

data.job_description:
Company Description

Join us and make YOUR mark on the World!

Are you interested in joining some of the brightest talent in the world to strengthen the United States’ security? Come join Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory (LLNL) where our employees apply their expertise to create solutions for BIG ideas that make our world a better place.

We are committed to a diverse and equitable workforce with an inclusive culture that values and celebrates the diversity of our people, talents, ideas, experiences, and perspectives. This is essential to innovation and creativity for continued success of the Laboratory’s mission.

Pay

$108,840 Annually

Job Description

We are excited to offer an opportunity for a Postdoctoral Researcher to conduct research in atmospheric modeling for a variety of applications including wind energy, flow over complex terrain, and transport and dispersion of hazardous materials. Research projects for these applications require multi-scale atmospheric modeling, spanning from the mesoscale to the microscale, and often require development of the atmospheric simulation codes for improved performance. Familiarity with turbulence and surface-layer modeling, including canopy models, is desired, as is knowledge of atmospheric physics parameterizations. You will work with a multidisciplinary team of scientists, engineers, programmers, and project managers to develop and apply new modeling capabilities for wind energy assessments, meteorological forecasts in complex terrain, and assessing the consequences of hazardous atmospheric releases.

This position is in the Atmospheric, Earth & Energy Division, Atmospheric Science Research and Applications Group, and will also involve working with the National Atmospheric Release Advisory Center (NARAC, seehttps://narac.llnl.gov).

In this role you will
• Conduct creative research in the field of atmospheric modeling.
• Develop, validate, and apply computer models performing dynamically downscaled atmospheric simulations over complex terrain.
• Analyze model and observational datasets relevant to wind energy and transport and dispersion applications.
• Document research by publishing papers in peer-reviewed journals and present technical results at scientific conferences.
• Collaborate with others in a multidisciplinary team environment to accomplish research goals.
• Perform other duties as assigned.

Qualifications
• Ability to secure and maintain a U.S. DOE Q-level security clearance which requires U.S. Citizenship.
• PhD in atmospheric science, mechanical, civil or environmental engineering, computational science, or a closely related field.
• Experience in one or more of the following areas: atmospheric science, multi-scale or microscale atmospheric modeling, turbulence and surface-layer modeling, canopy models, regional atmospheric flow, atmospheric boundary layer dynamics, computational fluid dynamics, large-eddy simulation, atmospheric chemistry, aerosol science, or field data analysis.
• Experience with numerical methods and modern model development practices.
• Familiarity with programming languages including Fortran, Python, and MATLAB.
• Experience conducting research in atmospheric science, engineering, or a closely related field.
• Travel as required to collaborate with researchers or attend meetings and conferences.
• Experience with large model and observational datasets, modern programming environments, and visualization techniques.
• Proficient verbal and written communication skills, as evidenced by published results and presentations.

Qualifications We Desire
• Experience with the Weather Research and Forecasting (WRF) model.
• Familiarity with MPI/ OpenMP or GPU programming for supercomputing.
• Experience with atmospheric boundary layer turbulence, uncertainty quantification, ensembles, statistical analysis, or nuclear/radiological sources and effects.

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Position Information

This is a Postdoctoral appointment with the possibility of extension to a maximum of three years, open to those who have been awarded a PhD at time of hire date.

Why Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory?
• Flexible Benefits Package
• 401(k)
• Relocation Assistance
• Education Reimbursement Program
• Flexible schedules (*depending on project needs)
• Inclusion, Diversity, Equity and Accountability (IDEA) - visit https://www.llnl.gov/diversity
• Our core beliefs - visit https://www.llnl.gov/diversity/our-values
• Employee engagement - visit https://www.llnl.gov/diversity/employee-engagement

Security Clearance

This position requires a Department of Energy (DOE) Q-level clearance. If you are selected, we will initiate a Federal background investigation to determine if you meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information or matter. Also, all L or Q cleared employees are subject to random drug testing. Q-level clearance requires U.S. citizenship.

Pre-Employment Drug Test

External applicant(s) selected for this position must pass a post-offer, pre-employment drug test. This includes testing for use of marijuana as Federal Law applies to us as a Federal Contractor.

Equal Employment Opportunity

We are an equal opportunity employer that is committed to providing all with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, marital status, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, protected veteran status, age, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.

We invite you to review the Equal Employment Opportunity posters which include EEO is the Law and Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision.

Reasonable Accommodation

Our goal is to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates applying and interviewing at the Laboratory. If you need a reasonable accommodation during the application or the recruiting process, please use our online form to submit a request.

California Privacy Notice

The California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) grants privacy rights to all California residents. The law also entitles job applicants, employees, and non-employee workers to be notified of what personal information LLNL collects and for what purpose. The Employee Privacy Notice can be accessed here.

Our client, a world-leading Pharmaceutical Company in West Chester, PA is currently looking for a Research Associate / ELISA to join their expanding team.

Job Title: Research Associate / ELISA / Pharma Industry

Duration: 12 months contract, extendable up to 24 Months

Location: West Chester, PA

data.job_description:
Amazon's Advertising Recruiting team is building a Talent Research team in Palo Alto.
We are seeking a customer-obsessed Lead Talent Researcher who thrives on diving deep for information, and turning that information into actionable results.
The global marketplace for technical talent is increasingly competitive.
The individuals we seek are the driving force behind innovation and progress for Amazon and our competitors.
As the battle for technical talent becomes increasingly fierce, we must seek out ways to innovate and deliver high quality technical talent at a scale like never before.
As a Lead Talent Researcher on the Amazon Advertising recruiting team, you will immerse yourself in our peculiar and inclusive ways.
You will gain a deep understanding of the Amazon Advertising business, our current population of technical talent, and the global technical talent marketplace.
The Talent Acquisition Research team is addicted to data and information discovery that will help them generate pockets of talent otherwise uncovered by traditional sourcing methods.
We measure everything we do to ensure optimal value to our customers.
This includes performance drivers, research quality, diversity, and customer satisfaction.
We are embedded within the Advertising recruiting team and partner closely with our peers in sourcing and lead recruiter roles.
Responsibilities:
The Lead Talent Acquisition Researcher will build and execute research strategies for organizational talent mapping, identifying high-value talent, leveraging employee networks and track candidate lifecycles.
This individual will partner with the Recruiting team to understand long-term organizational hiring needs, create a database of passive talent, and build engagement with that talent over time.
This person is passionate about creating innovative tools and methodologies for discovering and tracking talent communities.
Lead a team of 3-4 Talent Researchers Talent Mapping/Org Chart development - you will be responsible for understanding the complex technical talent marketplace and build a strong understanding of our competitive landscape through organizational chart mapping Collaborate with our Sourcing teams to create efficient search strategies Discover and track talent in geographical locations where Amazon Advertising currently has a presence and will grow in the future Develop talent research case studies for individual teams or product areas within the Advertising business Construct curated directory of qualified candidates who are available to engage; and partner with recruiting peers to ensure an effective knowledge transfer for outreach activitiesYou can learn more about Amazon Advertising via our site:
https:
//advertising.
amazon.
com/.
Estimated Salary: $20 to $28 per hour based on qualifications.

data.job_title: Building or Health Science Researcher (Rochester, NY)
data.job_description:
The Well Living Lab (WLL) is seeking an experienced Health or Building Science Researcher to conduct original research on the effects of the indoor environment on human health and well-being. They will be expected to collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of researchers, technologists, operations staff, and academic and industry collaborators. As the WLL’s mission is centered around improving human health and well-being through innovative, science-based solutions that improve indoor environmental quality, the ideal candidate should be comfortable translating and applying discoveries for societal and business impact.

Responsibilities/Tasks:
• Generate research ideas and research proposals in collaboration with larger WLL team
• When possible, seek or help seek extramural funding to complete research studies
• Serve as scientific leader or co-leader of WLL research programs and/or studies by directing the design, planning, and execution of research protocols while collaborating daily with a multidisciplinary team of researchers, technologists, data scientists, and operations staff within the WLL
• Direct or help direct the design or selection, as well as the subsequent implementation, of tools/devices to appropriately capture environmental and health data
• Direct or help direct the collection, management, and analysis of data using advanced statistical methods
• Create or help create innovative concepts, methods, and products and generate intellectual property (IP)
• Prepare manuscripts, presentations, reports, and other documentation based on research observations. Assume major responsibility to advance the key goal of publishing peer-reviewed manuscripts in top-tier journals and presenting at major conferences prioritized by the WLL
• Actively collaborate with research organizations (Universities, Mayo Clinic, etc.) and industry partner companies (WLL Alliance Members) with relevant health and building science expertise
• Direct or help direct the integration of the WLL’s research into broader platforms and frameworks for research and development as well as innovation
• Stay up to date on the literature in the rapidly evolving fields of building and health science to help the WLL maintain a cutting-edge research plan and framework
• Actively promote WLL research via multiple media platforms

Required Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:
• Completion of a master’s degree in a health science-related field—biomedical engineering preferred but also considering other areas such as cognitive neuroscience, physiology, psychological well-being, etc.—or building science-related field—architectural engineering preferred but also strongly considering other areas such as mechanical, civil, or electrical engineering, etc. Possess some experience completing academic and/or industry research
• A research background and early track record of applying knowledge and skills towards advancing the science of the impact of the indoor environment on human health and well-being
• An understanding of research techniques and principles
• Early experience planning, executing, and/or reporting human research studies
• Experience and understanding of the IRB protocol writing and submission process
• Experience collecting, processing, and analyzing data; experience working with large datasets and statistical programming
• Some experience publishing in peer-reviewed journals and presenting at conferences
• Demonstrated skills and experience developing and leading or co-leading research projects/teams. Organizational and project management skills to handle multiple concurrent projects
• A positive attitude, open mind, demonstrated flexibility/adaptability, and a desire to collaborate with and learn from the multidisciplinary team within the WLL as well as externally with our academic and industry collaborators
• Strong verbal and written communication skills to effectively communicate with all levels of organizations and external audiences

Preferred Knowledge/Skills/Abilities
• Completion of a doctoral degree in a health science-related field—biomedical engineering preferred but also considering other areas such as cognitive neuroscience, physiology, psychological well-being, etc.—or building science-related field—architectural engineering preferred but also strongly considering other areas such as mechanical, civil, or electrical engineering, etc.
• Possess some experience completing academic and/or industry research. Completion of at least 2 years of post-doctoral training and/or a similar duration of research experience in an academic and/or industry research laboratory is also preferred but not required
• An exceptional research background and track record of applying knowledge and skills towards advancing the science of the impact of the indoor environment on human health and well-being
• Deep understanding of research techniques and principles
• Experience planning, executing, and reporting human research studies
• Understanding of the IRB protocol writing and submission process
• Experience collecting, processing, and analyzing data; experience working with large datasets and statistical programming
• Experience in the grant writing process
• Demonstrated track record of publishing in peer-reviewed journals and presenting at conferences
• Strong skills and experience developing and leading research projects/teams. Proven organizational and project management skills to handle multiple concurrent projects
• A positive attitude, open mind, demonstrated flexibility/adaptability, and a desire to collaborate with and learn from the multidisciplinary team within the WLL as well as externally with our academic and industry collaborators
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills to effectively communicate with all levels of organizations and external audiences

Compensation: Salary for this position is competitive and commensurate with prior experience. A comprehensive benefits package is included for full-time employees.

Applicants are selected based upon their qualifications for this position and without regard to the applicant’s race, color, ethnic or national origin, religion, creed, age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, marital or partnership status, citizenship or alienage status, veteran status, whether children are, may be or would be residing with a person, or any other characteristic protected by law.

About Delos:

As the pioneer of Wellness Real Estate™ and founder of the WELL Building Standard™, Delos is transforming our homes, offices, schools, and other indoor environments by placing health and wellness at the center of design and construction decisions. The Delos platform includes research, consulting, merchandising, and programming and licensing innovative solutions for the built environment, creating spaces that nurture and promote human health and wellbeing.

Exploring the intersection between humans and the built environment, Delos creates spaces that actively contribute to human health, performance and wellbeing by marrying the best innovations in technology, health, science, design, and enterprise. We see the built-environment as an asset to maximize human-potential and envision environments that enhance us. Environments that are proactive, enabling us to live better by cultivating better lifestyle choices and by solving health problems before they are created. We have broadened the scope of environmental sustainability, extending the concept beyond the best of green technology to an integrated solution that addresses human sustainability.

Our mission is to build a better world. Join us.

For additional information, please visit us at www.delos.com

About the Well Living Lab:

The Well Living Lab, a Delos and Mayo Clinic collaboration, was created to research the real-world impact of indoor environments on human health and wellbeing, and generate evidence-based information that can be used in practical ways to create healthier indoor spaces. For more information about the Lab, visit www.welllivinglab.com.

Qualifications: Possess some experience completing academic and/or industry research
A research background and early track record of applying knowledge and skills towards advancing the science of the impact of the indoor environment on human health and well-being
An understanding of research techniques and principles
Early experience planning, executing, and/or reporting human research studies
Experience and understanding of the IRB protocol writing and submission process
Experience collecting, processing, and analyzing data; experience working with large datasets and statistical programming

A positive attitude, open mind, demonstrated flexibility/adaptability, and a desire to collaborate with and learn from the multidisciplinary team within the WLL as well as externally with our academic and industry collaborators
Strong verbal and written communication skills to effectively communicate with all levels of organizations and external audiences
Proven organizational and project management skills to handle multiple concurrent projects

data.job_title: Senior Qualitative UX Researcher, Monetization Partnerships
data.job_description:
About Pinterest:

Millions of people across the world come to Pinterest to find new ideas every day. It’s where they get inspiration, dream about new possibilities and plan for what matters most. Our mission is to help those people find their inspiration and create a life they love. In your role, you’ll be challenged to take on work that upholds this mission and pushes Pinterest forward. You’ll grow as a person and leader in your field, all the while helping Pinners make their lives better in the positive corner of the internet.

Our new progressive work model is called PinFlex, a term that’s uniquely Pinterest to describe our flexible approach to living and working. Visit our PinFlex landing page to learn more.
We’re looking for a qualitative researcher who has worked on digital experiences and specializes in actionable insights that drive impact on products related to Advertisers and Developers. This position will be embedded with cross-functional product and design teams. The ideal candidate is an experienced researcher who can lead, design, execute, and communicate impactful research throughout the product development process.

What you’ll do:

• Prioritize and conduct research that varies in approach, scale, scope, timeframe and methodologies across multiple work streams, making sure to work on the right project at the right time
• Select and communicate the appropriate method or mix of methods to answer questions for product teams and our broader company
• Build strong relationships as a strategic partner with Monetization Product, Design, Engineering, Writing, Analytics, Product Marketing & Sales teams at Pinterest to identify high impact work and ensure it lands within the organization
• Proactively communicate and share research findings with product teams, executives, and other audiences in compelling, actionable, and engaging ways
• Influence others through insights to shape how businesses use Pinterest, ranging from mobile and desktop tools, and including experiences for both new and existing businesses.
• Help build the research culture at Pinterest, serving as a subject matter expert at a technical (craft, methodology, operations) and domain (product, user, organizational) level

What we're looking for:

• 3+ years experience designing and conducting end-to-end product research (from initial design and recruitment through final deliverable) in complex product domains (eg: developer products, ads, business, fintech, etc.) ideally in advertising or developer space
• Ability to toggle between owning and executing end-to-end research and leveraging insights to shape strategy and influence decision making with senior leaders
• Experience contributing to cross-functional teams to drive changes with research insights, excellent communication and collaboration skills
• Curiosity, self-awareness, humility, and a drive for growth, learning, and sharing knowledge

This position is not eligible for relocation assistance.

#LI-REMOTE

#LI-BL5

At Pinterest we believe the workplace should be equitable, inclusive, and inspiring for every employee. In an effort to provide greater transparency, we are sharing the base salary range for this position. The position is also eligible for equity. Final salary is based on a number of factors including location, travel, relevant prior experience, or particular skills and expertise.

Information regarding the culture at Pinterest and benefits available for this position can be found here.

data.job_description:
Tinder empowers users around the world to create new connections that otherwise might never have been possible! We build products that bring people together and are a small team with a focus on individual responsibility and rapid development. We are looking for a hardworking and experienced Senior UX Researcher to work on our Product Design team and partners cross functionally across Product Management, Data, Consumer Insights, etc. As a Senior UX Researcher at Tinder, you will lead end-to-end research initiatives for all groups across both within our team and the broader organization!

What you'll do:
• Interact directly with the UX Research Manager and UX Research Team, Product Designers, Product Managers, and Consumer Insights Researchers to define research objectives, plan, and implement research plans
• Function as a project lead and hands-on contributor - conducting primary and secondary user research, using a variety of methodologies, both qualitative and quantitative
• Work closely with cross-functional teams to identify and evaluate research topics across all areas of the business
• Collaborate and communicate in a way that amplifies the voice of our users, and influences product strategy and design
• Advocate research findings to designers and diverse audiences through written reports and presentations
• Test design solutions to ensure we’re solving top user needs as we evolve our products

What we're looking for:
• 4+ years of UX research experience with various methodologies, experience integrating user research findings into product designs and design practices, and experience leading end-to-end research initiatives
• Bachelor's degree in Design, HCI or Human Behavior related field, or equivalent experience preferred
• Shown ability to lead, conduct, and socialize UX research including (but not necessarily limited to, usability testing, focus groups, user interviews, user surveys, ethnographic research, persona development, etc.)
• Proactive, organized, and able to balance multiple projects and their own initiatives. Must be a motivated self-starter and have excellent time-management skills
• Comfortable performing all research-related tasks including research, planning, evaluating, and iteration
• A strong desire for creative problem-solving with a positive low ego
• Strong curiosity about social app products, Gen Z, and associated trends

Bonus Points:
• Experience with Figma, Sketch, Principle, and other design & prototyping platforms
• Experience using data analytics tools
• Experience mentoring interns and associates

As part of our team, you'll enjoy:
• Comprehensive health coverage, competitive salary, 401(k) employer match, Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP).

Job Description:
• The UX Researcher will serve as a voice for the user, utilizing broad skills in both qualitative and quantitative research to facilitate a user-centered design process.
• In addition, you will help scale user research at the client by joining a team of user researchers within a growing tech and design space.
• You and your team will become trusted and work with a diverse set of state partners to understand, improve, and test varied government products and designs.

data.job_description:
About Pinterest:

Millions of people across the world come to Pinterest to find new ideas every day. It’s where they get inspiration, dream about new possibilities and plan for what matters most. Our mission is to help those people find their inspiration and create a life they love. In your role, you’ll be challenged to take on work that upholds this mission and pushes Pinterest forward. You’ll grow as a person and leader in your field, all the while helping Pinners make their lives better in the positive corner of the internet.

Our new progressive work model is called PinFlex, a term that’s uniquely Pinterest to describe our flexible approach to living and working. Visit our PinFlex landing page to learn more.

We’re looking for a talented quantitative UX Researcher who’s worked on digital products and has a knack for discovering actionable insights about consumers. You’re a dedicated researcher who can mix survey science with behavioral analysis to design, execute, and communicate strategic research on a deadline in a fast paced environment. This role is embedded within the Growth team and will help shape how we identify and prioritize needs of new users, dormant users, and international audiences.

Learn more about Quant UX Research at Pinterest:
• What is quantitative user experience research at Pinterest?
• How we define, build, and scale quantitative UX research at Pinterest

What you’ll do:
• Prioritize and conduct research that varies in approach, scale, scope, timeframe and methodology across multiple work streams, making sure to work on the right project at the right time
• Explore the intersection of attitudes and behaviors through expert surveys and deep behavioral analysis
• Generate research insights that can be used to inform product, brand, and business decisions
• Build strong relationships as a strategic partner with Product, Design, Engineering, and Data Science to identify high impact work and ensure it lands within teams
• Partner closely with qualitative researchers and market researchers to build upon each others’ work and develop compelling narratives about research findings
• Proactively communicate and share your research findings with stakeholders, leadership, and other audiences

What we’re looking for:
• Expert in quantitative research methods, analysis, visualizations and relevant data tools like R/Python and SQL
• 3+ years of experience conducting user experience research with large data sets, preferably on consumer facing digital software
• PhD preferred, in computational social sciences (e.g,. Economics, sociology, psychology), statistics, computer science, related field, or equivalent practical experience
• Experience with survey methodology, including experience developing surveys and analyzing survey data
• Experience conducting market research (surveying off-platform audiences) preferred
• Experience collaborating with qualitative and market researchers, and understanding the value of their methods and approaches
• A self-starter, someone who is self-directed and capable of working autonomously to keep projects moving forward

This position is not eligible for relocation assistance.

#LI-BL5

#LI-REMOTE

At Pinterest we believe the workplace should be equitable, inclusive, and inspiring for every employee. In an effort to provide greater transparency, we are sharing the base salary range for this position. The position is also eligible for equity. Final salary is based on a number of factors including location, travel, relevant prior experience, or particular skills and expertise.

Information regarding the culture at Pinterest and benefits available for this position can be found here.

US based applicants only
$172,500—$258,700 USD

Our Commitment to Diversity:

Pinterest is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit. We want to have the best qualified people in every job. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic under federal, state, or local law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you require an accommodation during the job application process, please notify accessibility@pinterest.com for support.

Blade edge development is a critical part of sustaining a competitive advantage for Gillette grooming products. The R&D Blades FEI, Design & Development group is responsible for new blade concept development, process prototyping, material and product development to enable new and improved blade edge designs. Based on assigned projects, the work may span across multiple areas and phases of development including a focus on conceiving, inventing, and demonstrating novel blade edge designs; understanding fundamental mechanisms; integration of new blade edge designs within a shaving system; new material and process invention; prototyping at various scales; and analytical method development and testing.

The selected candidate will coordinate experiments and conduct testing with a variety of prototyping methods and instrumentation techniques to provide insights for fundamental research to prove new product concepts, assess new materials, and develop material and product specifications to deliver superior benefits in our consumer shaving products within major brands like Gillette and Venus. The candidate will work with state-of-the-art technologies and equipment within a multi-discipline R&D team while collaborating closely with other functions within teams (e.g. Blade Process Development, Consumer Research, Analytical/Measurement Science, Quality Assurance, and other Product Design groups).

Important Responsibilities
• Planning, execution, and documentation of trial runs within R&D prototyping and pilot labs in collaboration with engineers
• Product testing utilizing routine and developmental methods. May include visual and/or mechanical review of product to support establishing specifications and assessing new materials and processes.
• Troubleshooting and problem-solving issues during trials and providing hands-on practical expertise to developing solutions for quality and processing issues.
• Maintain complete and accurate records in lab documentation system. Document results summaries including process data, product testing results, and relevant material data in collaboration with engineers.
• Maintain lab area and equipment through regular calibration and maintenance per established requirements and standards. Maintain proper level of operating supplies and recommend replacement or upgrades to improve efficiency.

Skills You Can Expect to Learn/Build in This Role :

Product, material and process development, experimental techniques (design of experiments, etc.), Electronic Lab Notebook system, Quickbase application, blade process prototyping & instrumentation techniques, data analysis (Excel, JMP).

Qualifications
• 2-5 years experience in a lab environment
• Associate’s degree in a technology or Engineering field is preferred or a high school diploma with relevant work experience.
• Passion to learn product, material, and process fundamentals, lab equipment operation, and how blade characteristics relate to performance. Ability to learn on the job in a dynamic environment.
• In an R&D environment, having a methodical, & disciplined approach to problem solving, executing testing, & communicating key findings is critical to providing accurate results from experiments. Attention to detail & ability to identify potential issues proactively.
• Ability to learn various technologies and provide detailed observations and hands-on testing to support problem solving with engineers.
• Strong mechanical skills related to equipment operation, maintenance & troubleshooting. Experience operating thin film coating process equipment a plus.
• Strong organization skills to coordinate multiple tasks & projects with right sense of urgency. Have a bias for action & take strong ownership in troubleshooting issues in a lab environment. Ability to work with ambiguity & adapt to changing priorities.
• Teamwork and collaboration are important within R&D. Strong communication skills required to provide input on technical requirements and approach to testing with Engineers and to work across several lab areas.
• Experience in use of measurement equipment including standard and non-standard techniques is a plus (e.g. microscopes, force testing, SEM, FTIR, XPS, etc)
• Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, Powerpoint. Experience with basic statistics is preferred. Experience in technical report writing and documentation of technical and operational procedures.

Skills You Can Expect to Learn/Build in This Job :

Product, material and process development, experimental techniques (design of experiments, etc.), Electronic Lab Notebook system, Blades Quickbase application, blade process prototyping & instrumentation techniques, data analysis (Excel, JMP).

Other Information

Job scope may be adjusted depending on candidate's experience level.

Just So You Know:

Pay Range: $75,100 - $86,400

Compensation for roles at P&G varies depending on a wide array of non-discriminatory factors including but not limited to the specific office location, role, degree/credentials, relevant skill set, and level of relevant experience. At P&G compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. Total Rewards at P&G include salary + bonus (if applicable) + benefits. data.employer_name: Tufts Physician Organization, Tufts Physician Organization
data.job_publisher: Careers | Tufts Medical Center - Tufts Medicine
data.job_title: Diversity, Racism, Social Justice, & Health Disparities Researcher
data.job_description:
We’re saving lives, building careers, and reimaging healthcare. We can’t wait to grow alongside you.

The Institute for Clinical Research and Health Policy Studies (ICRHPS) at Tufts Medical Center and Tufts University School of Medicine, in collaboration with other Schools and centers of Tufts University seek a faculty Diversity, Racism, Social Justice, and Health Disparities Researcher to broaden innovative diversity, racial equity, health disparities scholarship at Tufts through research and teaching. This role will also contribute to synergist programming across Tufts diversity offices, Tufts Medical Center and those of our affiliated health system, Tufts Medicine, and Tufts Clinical and Translational Science Institute (CTSI). Tufts provides a supportive academic environment for original research and ample opportunities for collaboration and teaching.

Why Join Our Team:

The Diversity, Racism, Social Justice, and Health Disparities Researcher will join a growing community of faculty across Tufts leading research programs that address key issues relevant to reducing health disparities, including racism and discrimination at the individual and systems levels. This position focuses on increasing the relevance and effectiveness of translational research to improve human health and dismantling systemic racism.

The faculty researcher will be member of the Special and Scientific Staff of the Tufts Medical Center Physician Organization, which has a mission to heal, to comfort, to teach, to learn, and to seek knowledge to promote health and prevent disease. The faculty researcher will also have an academic appointment at Tufts University, with the opportunity for joint appointments in relevant Schools and Departments, including, but not limited to, Medicine, Public Health and Community Medicine, Nutrition, Veterinary Medicine, Dental Medicine, Arts and Sciences, and/or Engineering at the appropriate level, depending on the candidate’s area of research and academic interests. The faculty researcher will also have an appointment in the Tufts Medicine Center for Diversity, Equity, Inclusion (DEI), which has a mission to build an inclusive culture where people can thrive, advancing diversity, cultural competence, eliminating structural racism to achieve equity to enable the delivery of unmatched experiences and partner with communities to reduce health disparities.

How Your Work Will Transform Care:
• Advance the science of understanding and addressing diversity, racial, and health equity issues in translational research
• Provide guidance to Tufts CTSI, Tufts University, and the Tufts Medicine Center for DEI on joint initiatives with a focus on organizational culture, strategic planning and management, training and education, and diversifying the clinical and translational workforce
• Collaborate with clinical, health services, and basic science researchers throughout Tufts University and Tufts Medicine
• Teach and mentor potentially at the undergraduate, MS, MPH, resident, fellow, and PhD levels in relevant Tufts University programs, as well as faculty, staff, and diversity educators at Tufts and Tufts Medicine
• Join a group of clinical and translational researchers who cover a wide spectrum of disciplines, the new faculty member will develop their own research program and will have teaching and mentoring opportunities at both the graduate and undergraduate level.

Who You Are:
• Possess a PhD, MD, or an equivalent advanced degree in a clinical, social justice, racial equity, and/or a translational-related research field.
• An individual with interests across the full translational research spectrum, from bench to bedside, to clinical care, to health services, and health policy
• Have a track-record of academic productivity and research interests related to health equity and social determinants of health, the intersection of racism and health, and/or (DEI), and justice in academic medicine.
• Interest in, and experience with, diversity knowledge, curriculum development, and practices, and in fostering a workplace culture of belonging.
• Demonstrated ability, or potential, for securing external NIH funding is required. some graduate-level classroom teaching experience and interest in contributing to DEI programming.

Employees of Tufts Medical Center Physician Organization receive:
• Guaranteed Base Salary
• Academic Appointment through Tufts University School of Medicine
• Substantive 401A retirement plan
• CME Funds and Time Away
• Generous Vacation and Holiday Policy
• Robust Benefits Package

Location: Tufts Medical Center, Boston, MA; and Tufts University, Boston, Medford, and Grafton, MA campuses

How to apply: You can apply for this position via the apply button located at the top of this listing.

Should you have any questions regarding the position or any complications submitting an application with us, please feel free to reach out to Ian McCarthy, Senior Provider Recruiter, at Ian.Mccarthy@tuftsmedicine.org.

Tufts Medical Center Physician Organization DEI and Social Responsibility Statement: We truly believe our employees’ diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives are a powerful contributor to create an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their maximum potential while adding value to both our organization and our clients. We warmly welcome all candidates of diverse origin, background, ability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, and personality.

Tufts University Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: Tufts University, founded in 1852, prioritizes quality teaching, highly competitive basic and applied research, and a commitment to active citizenship locally, regionally, and globally. Tufts University also prides itself on creating a diverse, equitable, and inclusive community. Current and prospective employees of the University are expected to have, and continuously develop, skill in, and disposition for, positively engaging with a diverse population of faculty, staff, and students.

Tufts University is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We are committed to increasing the diversity of our faculty and staff and fostering their success when hired. Members of underrepresented groups are welcome and strongly encouraged to apply. See the University’s Non-Discrimination statement and policy here?https://oeo.tufts.edu/policies-procedures/non-discrimination/.

Tufts Medicine is a leading integrated health system bringing together the best of academic and community healthcare to deliver exceptional, connected and accessible care experiences to consumers across Massachusetts. Comprised of Tufts Medical Center, Lowell General Hospital, MelroseWakefield Hospital, Lawrence Memorial Hospital of Medford, Care at Home — an expansive home care network, and large integrated physician network. Please note that effective October 1, 2021, as a condition of employment at Tufts Medicine, all employees and new hires must have received their complete dose of the COVID-19 vaccine, unless they have been granted an exemption. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity and inclusion at Tufts Medicine. Tufts Medicine does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, national origin, gender identity and/or expression, marital status or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation by emailing us at careers@tuftsmedicine.org.

data.job_description:
The School of Public Health is seeking applications for a 9742R5 – Researcher 5 (Biostatistician) in the Division of Biostatistics

The School of Public Health (SPH) is committed to anti-racism and anti-oppression and welcomes you to join us in our pursuit of building equity and driving justice. We particularly encourage applications from those who belong to groups that have been historically underrepresented in our School, including those who are Black, Indigenous, and people of color, those with disabilities, veterans, and those from LGBTQIA+ communities.

Are you excited about this job and meet the required qualifications, but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every preferred qualification? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. If this is you, we strongly encourage you to apply because you just may be the right candidate for this role.

Please note: At this time, the University’s employment site is limited in how it collects applicant demographic information. Applicants are encouraged to provide their preferred name and/or pronouns within their attached application materials.

About the Job
The Division of Biostatistics in the University of Minnesota’s School of Public Health is seeking a biostatistician to join a newly formed group led by Drs. David Vock and Erika Helgeson focusing on outcomes research in solid organ transplantation. The position is supported by a mixture of grant funding and internal sources. Current projects involve analysis of large national and international registries and granular local data. The Division of Biostatistics provides a positive and supportive working environment, including supporting flexible working arrangements and professional development opportunities. The position is an annually renewable professional academic appointment.

In collaboration with investigators in the Division of Transplant Surgery and other researchers throughout the University of Minnesota duties for these positions include:
• Observational design and planning (10%): protocol development and writing statistical analysis plans for both grant applications and federally-funded projects.
• Data management (30%): cleaning and manipulation using REDCap and R; preparation of study datasets for data analysis; development of reports for data entry errors/missing data/queries for prospectively collected data.
• Data analysis and dissemination (60%): conducting analyses for investigators typically using methods for survival analysis, correlated data, causal inference, and novel machine learning methods; drafting results, tables, and figures for peer-reviewed manuscripts and presentations; developing Shiny applications/online dashboards and other forms of disseminations.

Work Arrangements
The position will work at the University Office Plaza which houses Division of Biostatistics. Hybrid work options are currently available with a minimum of 2 days in office during regular business hours.

Starting Salary Range: $75,000 -$100,000+, depending on qualifications

Required Qualifications
• MS in biostatistics, statistics, or a related field
• Demonstrated competence using SAS or R for data analysis
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills
• Experience working independently
